main event: An engineer observed a brilliantly illuminated circular object emitting a reddish-orange glow in the sky near Cleveland, Ohio, on 26 May 1954.
interesting points: The object was self-luminous and made no sound,The observer estimated it to be 40-50 feet in diameter,The sighting lasted for about 2 minutes before the object accelerated and disappeared,No radar or ground contact was made during the observation,The object was chased by an F-86 but was always abreast on a course of 300Â°.
sighted object: a circular, self-luminous object emitting reddish-orange glow
